Camps Road, Haverhill
CB9 8HB

Tel: 01440 702638
Email: help@suffolklibraries.co.uk
Friends group: Friends of Haverhill Library

Branch facilities

  • Accessibility information
  • Autism–friendly guide to the library (PDF)
  • Payments: cash, cheques and cards accepted
  • Parking: available for disabled customers and deliveries only
  • Out-of-hours book return available
  • Refreshments: caf√© open 1000-1600 on weekdays
  • Display space: Small table top/banner display spaces available in the foyer and library, glass display cabinet and large display board available in the library

IT and printing facilities

  • Free wifi
  • Book a computer
  • Borrow a BBC micro:bit
  • Photocopying: available
  • Colour printing: available
  • Scan to email
  • Printing, photocopying & scanning charges

Regular events and activities

Children's events

Baby Bounce: soothing songs and gentle nursery rhymes for babies, up to 18 months old

Friday, 1000-1030

Craft activities: for primary school age children

Sunday, 1030-1200

Storytime: stories for pre-school children

Monday, 1000-1030

Tot Rock: songs and action rhymes for toddlers, from 18 months to pre-school age

Tuesday, 1000-1030

Summer Reading Challenge

Summer Reading Challenge - tell us about your latest book, collect rewards and choose your next book

every day, library opening hours

Older people's events

Top Time: events and activities for older people

Wednesday, 1030-1200

Reading groups

Bookworms reading group

second Saturday of the month, 1430-1600

Chapter Chasers kids' book club

third Sunday of the month, 1030-1130

Page Turners book group

third Saturday of the month, 1430-1600

IT help

1:1 IT tutorials on PC or tablets: ¬£5 for half an hour, ¬£7.50 for up to an hour

Sessions arranged on a mutually convenient basis, N/a

Language courses

ESL chat - meet other people whose first language is not English, share your native language with the community and improve your English conversation. Tea and coffee provided

Sunday every 2 weeks, 1400-1500

Arts, crafts & games

Free adult colouring - materials & patterns provided

Sunday, 1330-1530

Health & wellbeing events

Open space: drop in for health info, activities and chat. All welcome. Free tea and coffee provided.

Fridays from 4 August, 1230-1430

History

Family history group: help and guidance with the Suffolk Family History Society

Wednesday, 1400-1600
